title: Stocks fall as China threatens to retaliate for new tariffs
text: Stocks tumbled Friday toward their worst week of 2019, as investors fretted over an escalating trade war with China. The Dow Jones industrial average slid 334.18 points to 26,249.22 at its lowest point Friday after China vowed to retaliate over threatened US tariffs on another $300 billion worth of Chinese goods.

title: US labor force hits new high amid rising trade tensions
text: The US labor force grew to a new high of 163.4 million last month — a record that was overshadowed Friday by rising trade tensions. The Labor Department Friday reported that 164,000 non-farm jobs were added to the economy in July — a bump that was aided by 370,000 new workers entering the labor force.

title: US says 'no free trade deal with UK unless digital tax scrapped'
text: The US will not negotiate a free trade deal with the UK unless a new digital services tax is dropped, according to a report.

title: Spiraling Trade Tensions Threaten Economy as Trump Pressures China
text: The S&P 500 recorded its worst week this year as investors were rattled by renewed trade tensions that threatened to undermine the global economy.

title: Cramer: How to know when it pays to sell in a sell-off
text: Jim Cramer tells investors what to look for to determine whether a sell-off is built to last.

title: Cramer unpacks 'mechanical' market crashes that have nothing to do with the economy
text: Jim Cramer recounts his experience on Black Monday and explains why market crashes don't always mean the economy is failing.

title: We just had worst week of the year for stocks, do you buy or hide out?
text: Should investors buy now or hold on?

title: Key levels to watch in the S&P while markets wrap a rough week
text: Cornerstone Macro's Carter Worth on key levels to watch in the markets.

title: Trump instructed top aide to call China to warn more tariffs were coming: sources
text: As a tense meeting with top advisers on China trade talks ended, President Donald Trump turned to trade adviser Robert Lighthizer and told him to call China to warn that new tariffs were coming, two people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

title: Stocks, yields tumble as trade frictions unnerve traders
text: A measure of stocks across the globe posted on Friday its largest weekly loss of the year while yields in U.S. and German debt were near or at multi-year lows, after China vowed to retaliate against a possible new round of U.S. tariffs.

title: 'Tariffs are starting to come into play in the economy,' says financial advisor

title: Jobs report, tariffs and a rate cut—what pros say about this week

title: Dow Jones Today: Trade Trouble is a Real Problem

title: Stock Market Today: Fight the Fed or Fight the President?
text: Volatility remains in the market, with investors torn between the Fed and the trade war. Here's what happened in the stock market today.

title: Trump says China has to do a lot to turn things around in trade talks
text: President Donald Trump said on Friday China has to do a lot in order to turn things around in trade negotiations with the United States and that he can increase tariffs on Chinese goods.

title: China vows fight against Trump's latest tariffs as stocks sink
text: China on Friday vowed to fight back against U.S. President Donald Trump's abrupt decision to slap 10% tariffs on the remaining $300 billion in Chinese imports, a move that ended a month-long trade truce.

title: Wall Street sinks to 1-month low on trade, growth fears
text: Wall Street extended its sell-off on Friday as renewed U.S.-China trade jitters and a slowdown in job growth put all three major U.S. stock indexes on pace for their worst week since December, when markets hit their trough amid recession fears.

text: A measure of stocks across the globe was on track to post its largest weekly loss of the year on Friday while yields in U.S. and German debt were near multi-year lows, after China vowed to retaliate against a possible new round of U.S. tariffs.

title: Oil up 3%, recouping some losses from Trump tariffs comments

title: Wall Street sinks to one-month low on trade, growth fears
text: U.S. stocks tumbled to a one-month low on Friday after a sharp escalation in U.S.-China trade tensions and a tepid July jobs report renewed fears of slowing economic growth and raised bets of further interest rate cuts this year.
